title: Dennis Tito, first space tourist, books trip around the moon on SpaceX’s Starship
summary: Dennis Tito, an 82-year-old aerospace engineer-turned-financial analyst who paid Russia $20 million for a trip to the International Space Station in 2001, is working with SpaceX on plans to take his wife on what amounts to a belated honeymoon voyage to the moon.

title: NASA Awards Contracts to Assess Near-Space Communications Capabilities
summary: NASA has selected two companies – Kongsberg Satellite Services (KSAT) USA of Denver and SpaceLink Corporation of McLean, Virginia – to develop capability studies to explore and demonstrate communications and navigation services in support of Artemis missions to the Moon.

title: Amazon to launch two Project Kuiper satellites on Vulcan’s first flight
summary: The first two satellites of Amazon’s Project Kuiper broadband constellation — Kuipersat-1 and Kuipersat-2 — will launch on the maiden flight of United Launch Alliance's new Vulcan Centaur rocket

title: NASA says the Artemis I mission will be ready to launch in one month
summary: Set your alarm for 7 minutes after midnight on November 14.

title: On space matters, Biden’s national security strategy adopts a less combative tone
summary: The White House on Oct. 12 released a long-delayed national security strategy that lays out challenges the United States faces in a tripolar world.
